info.title: Rooch JSON-RPC
info.description: Rooch JSON-RPC API for interaction with rooch server.

methods.name: btc_queryInscriptions
methods.description: Query the Inscription via global index by Inscription filter

methods.name: btc_queryUTXOs
methods.description: Query the UTXO via global index by UTXO filter

methods.name: rooch_executeRawTransaction
methods.description: Send the signed transaction in bcs hex format This method blocks waiting for the transaction to be executed.

methods.name: rooch_executeViewFunction
methods.description: Execute a read-only function call The function do not change the state of Application

methods.name: rooch_getBalance
methods.description: get account balance by AccountAddress and CoinType

methods.name: rooch_getEventsByEventHandle
methods.description: Get the events by event handle id

methods.name: rooch_getStates
methods.description: Get the states by access_path If the StateOptions.decode is true, the state is decoded and the decoded value is returned in the response.

methods.name: rooch_listStates
methods.description: List the states by access_path If the StateOptions.decode is true, the state is decoded and the decoded value is returned in the response.

methods.name: rooch_queryEvents
methods.description: Query the events indexer by event filter

methods.name: rooch_queryGlobalStates
methods.description: Query the global states indexer by state filter

methods.name: rooch_queryTableStates
methods.description: Query the table states indexer by state filter

methods.name: rooch_queryTransactions
methods.description: Query the transactions indexer by transaction filter

methods.name: rooch_sendRawTransaction
methods.description: Send the signed transaction in bcs hex format This method does not block waiting for the transaction to be executed.

methods.name: rooch_syncStates
methods.description: Sync state change sets from indexer

anyOf.description: u64, u128, U256 is too large to be serialized in json so we use string to represent them

oneOf.description: Query by event type.
Query by sender address.
Return events emitted by the given transaction hash.
Return events emitted in [start_time, end_time) interval

end_time.description: right endpoint of time interval, milliseconds since block, exclusive

start_time.description: left endpoint of time interval, milliseconds since block, inclusive

oneOf.description: Return events emitted in [from_order, to_order) interval

from_order.description: left endpoint of transaction order, inclusive

to_order.description: right endpoint of transaction order, exclusive

EventID.description: A struct that represents a globally unique id for an Event stream that a user can listen to. the Unique ID is a combination of event handle id and event seq number. the ID is local to this particular fullnode and will be different from other fullnode.

event_handle_id.description: each event handle corresponds to a unique event handle id. event handler id equal to guid.

event_seq.description: For expansion: The number of messages that have been emitted to the path previously

decode.description: If true, the event is decoded and the decoded value is returned in the response.

oneOf.description: Query by object value type and owner.
Query by object value type.
Query by owner.
Query by object id.
Query by multi chain address
Query by owner, represent by bitcoin address
Query by txid. Query by object id.

PageView_for_BalanceInfoView_and_alloc::.description: `next_cursor` points to the last item in the page; Reading with `next_cursor` will start from the next item after `next_cursor` if `next_cursor` is `Some`, otherwise it will start from the first item.

PageView_for_EventView_and_uint64.description: `next_cursor` points to the last item in the page; Reading with `next_cursor` will start from the next item after `next_cursor` if `next_cursor` is `Some`, otherwise it will start from the first item.

PageView_for_TransactionWithInfoView_and.description: `next_cursor` points to the last item in the page; Reading with `next_cursor` will start from the next item after `next_cursor` if `next_cursor` is `Some`, otherwise it will start from the first item.

PageView_for_UTXOStateView_and_IndexerSt.description: `next_cursor` points to the last item in the page; Reading with `next_cursor` will start from the next item after `next_cursor` if `next_cursor` is `Some`, otherwise it will start from the first item.

SpecificStructView.description: Some specific struct that we want to display in a special way for better readability

decode.description: If true, the state is decoded and the decoded value is returned in the response.

Query by table handle.
Query by sender address.
Query by multi chain original address.
Query by the given transaction hash.
Return transactions in [start_time, end_time) interval

end_time.description: right endpoint of time interval, milliseconds since block, exclusive

start_time.description: left endpoint of time interval, milliseconds since block, inclusive

oneOf.description: Return events emitted in [from_order, to_order) interval

from_order.description: left endpoint of transaction order, inclusive
